read_timeout.description: Define a timeout value between two successive read operations to your origin server. Historically, the timeout value between two read options from Cloudflare to an origin server is 100 seconds. If you are attempting to reduce HTTP 524 errors because of timeouts from an origin server, try increasing this timeout value.
read_timeout.title: Read Timeout (Enterprise-only)

respect_strong_etags.description: Specify whether or not Cloudflare should respect strong ETag (entity tag) headers. When off, Cloudflare converts strong ETag headers to weak ETag headers.
respect_strong_etags.title: Respect Strong Etags

disable_stale_while_updating.title: Disable Stale While Updating

status_code_ttl.description: List of single status codes, or status code ranges to apply the selected mode

items.description: Specify how long Cloudflare should cache the response based on the status code from the origin. Can be a single status code or a range or status codes

status_code_range.description: The range of status codes used to apply the selected mode.
status_code_range.title: Status Code Range

status_code_value.description: Set the ttl for responses with this specific status code
status_code_value.title: Status Code Value

value.description: Time to cache a response (in seconds). A value of 0 is equivalent to setting the Cache-Control header with the value "no-cache". A value of -1 is equivalent to setting Cache-Control header with the value of "no-store".
value.title: TTL value

items.title: Status Code TTL

status_code_ttl.title: Status Code TTLs

edge_ttl.title: Edge TTL

origin_cache_control.description: When enabled, Cloudflare will aim to strictly adhere to RFC 7234.
origin_cache_control.title: Origin Cache Control (Enterprise-only)

origin_error_page_passthru.description: Generate Cloudflare error pages from issues sent from the origin server. When on, error pages will trigger for issues from the origin
origin_error_page_passthru.title: Origin Error Page Passthru

read_timeout.description: Define a timeout value between two successive read operations to your origin server. Historically, the timeout value between two read options from Cloudflare to an origin server is 100 seconds. If you are attempting to reduce HTTP 524 errors because of timeouts from an origin server, try increasing this timeout value.
read_timeout.title: Read Timeout (Enterprise-only)

respect_strong_etags.description: Specify whether or not Cloudflare should respect strong ETag (entity tag) headers. When off, Cloudflare converts strong ETag headers to weak ETag headers.
respect_strong_etags.title: Respect Strong Etags

serve_stale.description: Define if Cloudflare should serve stale content while getting the latest content from the origin. If on, Cloudflare will not serve stale content while getting the latest content from the origin.

disable_stale_while_updating.description: Defines whether Cloudflare should serve stale content while updating. If true, Cloudflare will not serve stale content while getting the latest content from the origin.
disable_stale_while_updating.title: Disable Stale While Updating

serve_stale.title: Serve Stale

geo.description: Use the user agents's country in the cache key.
geo.title: Country

lang.description: Use the user agent's language in the cache key.
lang.title: Language

user.title: User

custom_key.title: Custom Key

ignore_query_strings_order.description: Treat requests with the same query parameters the same, regardless of the order those query parameters are in. A value of true ignores the query strings' order.
ignore_query_strings_order.title: Ignore Query Strings Order

cache_key.title: Cache Key

cache_reserve.description: Mark whether the request's response from origin is eligible for  Cache Reserve (requires a Cache Reserve add-on plan).

eligible.description: Determines whether cache reserve is enabled. If this is true and a request meets eligibility criteria, Cloudflare will write the resource to cache reserve.
eligible.title: Eligible

minimum_file_size.description: The minimum file size eligible for store in cache reserve.
minimum_file_size.title: Minimum File Size

cache_reserve.title: CacheReserve

edge_ttl.description: TTL (Time to Live) specifies the maximum time to cache a resource in the Cloudflare edge network.

default.description: The TTL (in seconds) if you choose override_origin mode.
default.title: Default

mode.description: edge ttl options
mode.title: Mode

status_code_ttl.description: List of single status codes, or status code ranges to apply the selected mode

items.description: Specify how long Cloudflare should cache the response based on the status code from the origin. Can be a single status code or a range or status codes

status_code_range.description: The range of status codes used to apply the selected mode.
status_code_range.title: Status Code Range

status_code_value.description: Set the ttl for responses with this specific status code
status_code_value.title: Status Code Value

value.description: Time to cache a response (in seconds). A value of 0 is equivalent to setting the Cache-Control header with the value "no-cache". A value of -1 is equivalent to setting Cache-Control header with the value of "no-store".
value.title: TTL value

items.title: Status Code TTL

status_code_ttl.title: Status Code TTLs

edge_ttl.title: Edge TTL

origin_cache_control.description: When enabled, Cloudflare will aim to strictly adhere to RFC 7234.
origin_cache_control.title: Origin Cache Control (Enterprise-only)

origin_error_page_passthru.description: Generate Cloudflare error pages from issues sent from the origin server. When on, error pages will trigger for issues from the origin
origin_error_page_passthru.title: Origin Error Page Passthru

read_timeout.description: Define a timeout value between two successive read operations to your origin server. Historically, the timeout value between two read options from Cloudflare to an origin server is 100 seconds. If you are attempting to reduce HTTP 524 errors because of timeouts from an origin server, try increasing this timeout value.
read_timeout.title: Read Timeout (Enterprise-only)

respect_strong_etags.description: Specify whether or not Cloudflare should respect strong ETag (entity tag) headers. When off, Cloudflare converts strong ETag headers to weak ETag headers.
respect_strong_etags.title: Respect Strong Etags

serve_stale.description: Define if Cloudflare should serve stale content while getting the latest content from the origin. If on, Cloudflare will not serve stale content while getting the latest content from the origin.

disable_stale_while_updating.description: Defines whether Cloudflare should serve stale content while updating. If true, Cloudflare will not serve stale content while getting the latest content from the origin.
disable_stale_while_updating.title: Disable Stale While Updating

serve_stale.title: Serve Stale

status_code_range.description: The range of status codes used to apply the selected mode.

status_code_value.description: Set the ttl for responses with this specific status code

value.description: Time to cache a response (in seconds). A value of 0 is equivalent to setting the Cache-Control header with the value "no-cache". A value of -1 is equivalent to setting Cache-Control header with the value of "no-store".

origin_error_page_passthru.description: Generate Cloudflare error pages from issues sent from the origin server. When on, error pages will trigger for issues from the origin
origin_error_page_passthru.title: Origin Error Page Passthru

read_timeout.description: Define a timeout value between two successive read operations to your origin server. Historically, the timeout value between two read options from Cloudflare to an origin server is 100 seconds. If you are attempting to reduce HTTP 524 errors because of timeouts from an origin server, try increasing this timeout value.
read_timeout.title: Read Timeout (Enterprise-only)

respect_strong_etags.description: Specify whether or not Cloudflare should respect strong ETag (entity tag) headers. When off, Cloudflare converts strong ETag headers to weak ETag headers.
respect_strong_etags.title: Respect Strong Etags

serve_stale.description: Define if Cloudflare should serve stale content while getting the latest content from the origin. If on, Cloudflare will not serve stale content while getting the latest content from the origin.

disable_stale_while_updating.description: Defines whether Cloudflare should serve stale content while updating. If true, Cloudflare will not serve stale content while getting the latest content from the origin.
disable_stale_while_updating.title: Disable Stale While Updating

serve_stale.title: Serve Stale

read_timeout.description: Define a timeout value between two successive read operations to your origin server. Historically, the timeout value between two read options from Cloudflare to an origin server is 100 seconds. If you are attempting to reduce HTTP 524 errors because of timeouts from an origin server, try increasing this timeout value.
read_timeout.title: Read Timeout (Enterprise-only)

respect_strong_etags.description: Specify whether or not Cloudflare should respect strong ETag (entity tag) headers. When off, Cloudflare converts strong ETag headers to weak ETag headers.
respect_strong_etags.title: Respect Strong Etags

serve_stale.description: Define if Cloudflare should serve stale content while getting the latest content from the origin. If on, Cloudflare will not serve stale content while getting the latest content from the origin.

disable_stale_while_updating.description: Defines whether Cloudflare should serve stale content while updating. If true, Cloudflare will not serve stale content while getting the latest content from the origin.
disable_stale_while_updating.title: Disable Stale While Updating

serve_stale.title: Serve Stale

browser_ttl.description: Specify how long client browsers should cache the response. Cloudflare cache purge will not purge content cached on client browsers, so high browser TTLs may lead to stale content.

default.description: The TTL (in seconds) if you choose override_origin mode.

mode.description: Determines which browser ttl mode to use.
mode.title: Mode

browser_ttl.title: Browser TTL

cache.description: Mark whether the requests response from origin is eligible for caching. Caching itself will still depend on the cache-control header and your other caching configurations.
cache.title: Cache

cache_key.description: Define which components of the request are included or excluded from the cache key Cloudflare uses to store the response in cache.

cache_by_device_type.description: Separate cached content based on the visitors device type
cache_by_device_type.title: Cache by Device Type

cache_deception_armor.description: Protect from web cache deception attacks while allowing static assets to be cached
cache_deception_armor.title: Cache Deception Armor

custom_key.description: Customize which components of the request are included or excluded from the cache key.

cookie.description: The cookies to include in building the cache key.

check_presence.description: Checks for the presence of these cookie names. The presence of these cookies is used in building the cache key.

items.description: A cookie name to check presence of.
items.title: Cookie name

check_presence.title: Check presence of cookies

include.description: Include these cookies' names and their values.

items.description: Cookie name and corresponding value to include.
items.title: Cookie name

include.title: Include cookies

cookie.title: Cookie

header.description: The header names and values to include in building the cache key.

check_presence.description: Checks for the presence of these header names. The presence of these headers is used in building the cache key.

items.description: A header name to check presence of.
items.title: Header name

check_presence.title: Check presence of headers

additionalProperties.description: Check if the corresponding header contains any of the values in the list.
additionalProperties.title: Header values

contains.description: For each header name and list of values combination, check if the request header contains any of the values provided. The presence of the request header and whether any of the values provided are contained in the request header value is used in building the cache key.
contains.title: Header contains

exclude_origin.description: Whether or not to include the origin header. A value of true will exclude the origin header in the cache key.
exclude_origin.title: Exclude origin header

include.description: Include these headers' names and their values.

items.description: Header name and corresponding value to include.
items.title: Header name

include.title: Include headers

header.title: Headers

host.description: Whether to use the original host or the resolved host in the cache key.

resolved.description: Use the resolved host in the cache key. A value of true will use the resolved host, while a value or false will use the original host.
resolved.title: Use Resolved host

host.title: Host

query_string.description: Use the presence or absence of parameters in the query string to build the cache key.

exclude.description: build the cache key using all query string parameters EXCECPT these excluded parameters

all.description: Exclude all query string parameters from use in building the cache key.
all.title: All

list.description: A list of query string parameters NOT used to build the cache key. All parameters present in the request but missing in this list will be used to build the cache key.

items.description: A parameter in the list of query string parameters excluded from use in building a cache key.
items.title: parameter

list.title: List

exclude.title: Excluded query string parameters

include.description: build the cache key using a list of query string parameters that ARE in the request.

all.description: Use all query string parameters in the cache key.

items.description: parameter to include in the list of query string parameters used to build a cache key.
items.title: parameter

list.title: List

include.title: Included query string parameters

user.description: Characteristics of the request user agent used in building the cache key.

device_type.description: Use the user agent's device type in the cache key.
device_type.title: Device Type

geo.description: Use the user agents's country in the cache key.
geo.title: Country

lang.description: Use the user agent's language in the cache key.
lang.title: Language

user.title: User

custom_key.title: Custom Key

ignore_query_strings_order.description: Treat requests with the same query parameters the same, regardless of the order those query parameters are in. A value of true ignores the query strings' order.
ignore_query_strings_order.title: Ignore Query Strings Order

cache_key.title: Cache Key

cache_reserve.description: Mark whether the request's response from origin is eligible for  Cache Reserve (requires a Cache Reserve add-on plan).

eligible.description: Determines whether cache reserve is enabled. If this is true and a request meets eligibility criteria, Cloudflare will write the resource to cache reserve.
eligible.title: Eligible

minimum_file_size.description: The minimum file size eligible for store in cache reserve.
minimum_file_size.title: Minimum File Size

cache_reserve.title: CacheReserve

edge_ttl.description: TTL (Time to Live) specifies the maximum time to cache a resource in the Cloudflare edge network.

default.description: The TTL (in seconds) if you choose override_origin mode.
default.title: Default

mode.description: edge ttl options
mode.title: Mode

status_code_ttl.description: List of single status codes, or status code ranges to apply the selected mode

items.description: Specify how long Cloudflare should cache the response based on the status code from the origin. Can be a single status code or a range or status codes

status_code_range.description: The range of status codes used to apply the selected mode.
status_code_range.title: Status Code Range

status_code_value.description: Set the ttl for responses with this specific status code
status_code_value.title: Status Code Value

value.description: Time to cache a response (in seconds). A value of 0 is equivalent to setting the Cache-Control header with the value "no-cache". A value of -1 is equivalent to setting Cache-Control header with the value of "no-store".
value.title: TTL value

items.title: Status Code TTL

status_code_ttl.title: Status Code TTLs

edge_ttl.title: Edge TTL

origin_cache_control.description: When enabled, Cloudflare will aim to strictly adhere to RFC 7234.
origin_cache_control.title: Origin Cache Control (Enterprise-only)

origin_error_page_passthru.description: Generate Cloudflare error pages from issues sent from the origin server. When on, error pages will trigger for issues from the origin
origin_error_page_passthru.title: Origin Error Page Passthru

read_timeout.description: Define a timeout value between two successive read operations to your origin server. Historically, the timeout value between two read options from Cloudflare to an origin server is 100 seconds. If you are attempting to reduce HTTP 524 errors because of timeouts from an origin server, try increasing this timeout value.
read_timeout.title: Read Timeout (Enterprise-only)

respect_strong_etags.description: Specify whether or not Cloudflare should respect strong ETag (entity tag) headers. When off, Cloudflare converts strong ETag headers to weak ETag headers.
respect_strong_etags.title: Respect Strong Etags

serve_stale.description: Define if Cloudflare should serve stale content while getting the latest content from the origin. If on, Cloudflare will not serve stale content while getting the latest content from the origin.

disable_stale_while_updating.description: Defines whether Cloudflare should serve stale content while updating. If true, Cloudflare will not serve stale content while getting the latest content from the origin.
disable_stale_while_updating.title: Disable Stale While Updating

serve_stale.title: Serve Stale

cache_reserve.description: Mark whether the request's response from origin is eligible for  Cache Reserve (requires a Cache Reserve add-on plan).

eligible.title: Eligible

minimum_file_size.title: Minimum File Size

cache_reserve.title: CacheReserve

mode.description: edge ttl options
mode.title: Mode

status_code_ttl.description: List of single status codes, or status code ranges to apply the selected mode

items.description: Specify how long Cloudflare should cache the response based on the status code from the origin. Can be a single status code or a range or status codes

status_code_range.description: The range of status codes used to apply the selected mode.
status_code_range.title: Status Code Range

status_code_value.description: Set the ttl for responses with this specific status code
status_code_value.title: Status Code Value

value.description: Time to cache a response (in seconds). A value of 0 is equivalent to setting the Cache-Control header with the value "no-cache". A value of -1 is equivalent to setting Cache-Control header with the value of "no-store".

origin_cache_control.description: When enabled, Cloudflare will aim to strictly adhere to RFC 7234.
origin_cache_control.title: Origin Cache Control (Enterprise-only)

origin_error_page_passthru.description: Generate Cloudflare error pages from issues sent from the origin server. When on, error pages will trigger for issues from the origin
origin_error_page_passthru.title: Origin Error Page Passthru

read_timeout.description: Define a timeout value between two successive read operations to your origin server. Historically, the timeout value between two read options from Cloudflare to an origin server is 100 seconds. If you are attempting to reduce HTTP 524 errors because of timeouts from an origin server, try increasing this timeout value.
read_timeout.title: Read Timeout (Enterprise-only)

respect_strong_etags.description: Specify whether or not Cloudflare should respect strong ETag (entity tag) headers. When off, Cloudflare converts strong ETag headers to weak ETag headers.
respect_strong_etags.title: Respect Strong Etags

serve_stale.description: Define if Cloudflare should serve stale content while getting the latest content from the origin. If on, Cloudflare will not serve stale content while getting the latest content from the origin.

disable_stale_while_updating.description: Defines whether Cloudflare should serve stale content while updating. If true, Cloudflare will not serve stale content while getting the latest content from the origin.
disable_stale_while_updating.title: Disable Stale While Updating

serve_stale.title: Serve Stale

Historically, the timeout value between two read options from Cloudflare to an origin server is 100 seconds. If you are attempting to reduce HTTP 524 errors because of timeouts from an origin server, try increasing this timeout value.

exclude_origin.description: Whether or not to include the origin header. A value of true will exclude the origin header in the cache key.

cache_key.title: Cache Key

eligible.description: Determines whether cache reserve is enabled. If this is true and a request meets eligibility criteria, Cloudflare will write the resource to cache reserve.
eligible.title: Eligible

minimum_file_size.description: The minimum file size eligible for store in cache reserve.
minimum_file_size.title: Minimum File Size

cache_reserve.title: CacheReserve

edge_ttl.description: TTL (Time to Live) specifies the maximum time to cache a resource in the Cloudflare edge network.

default.description: The TTL (in seconds) if you choose override_origin mode.

mode.description: edge ttl options
mode.title: Mode

status_code_ttl.description: List of single status codes, or status code ranges to apply the selected mode

items.description: Specify how long Cloudflare should cache the response based on the status code from the origin. Can be a single status code or a range or status codes

status_code_range.description: The range of status codes used to apply the selected mode.
status_code_range.title: Status Code Range

status_code_value.description: Set the ttl for responses with this specific status code
status_code_value.title: Status Code Value

value.description: Time to cache a response (in seconds). A value of 0 is equivalent to setting the Cache-Control header with the value "no-cache". A value of -1 is equivalent to setting Cache-Control header with the value of "no-store".

origin_cache_control.title: Origin Cache Control (Enterprise-only)

origin_error_page_passthru.title: Origin Error Page Passthru

read_timeout.description: Define a timeout value between two successive read operations to your origin server. Historically, the timeout value between two read options from Cloudflare to an origin server is 100 seconds. If you are attempting to reduce HTTP 524 errors because of timeouts from an origin server, try increasing this timeout value.
read_timeout.title: Read Timeout (Enterprise-only)

respect_strong_etags.description: Specify whether or not Cloudflare should respect strong ETag (entity tag) headers. When off, Cloudflare converts strong ETag headers to weak ETag headers.
respect_strong_etags.title: Respect Strong Etags

serve_stale.description: Define if Cloudflare should serve stale content while getting the latest content from the origin. If on, Cloudflare will not serve stale content while getting the latest content from the origin.

disable_stale_while_updating.description: Defines whether Cloudflare should serve stale content while updating. If true, Cloudflare will not serve stale content while getting the latest content from the origin.
disable_stale_while_updating.title: Disable Stale While Updating

serve_stale.title: Serve Stale

read_timeout.description: Define a timeout value between two successive read operations to your origin server. Historically, the timeout value between two read options from Cloudflare to an origin server is 100 seconds. If you are attempting to reduce HTTP 524 errors because of timeouts from an origin server, try increasing this timeout value.
read_timeout.title: Read Timeout (Enterprise-only)

respect_strong_etags.description: Specify whether or not Cloudflare should respect strong ETag (entity tag) headers. When off, Cloudflare converts strong ETag headers to weak ETag headers.
respect_strong_etags.title: Respect Strong Etags

serve_stale.description: Define if Cloudflare should serve stale content while getting the latest content from the origin. If on, Cloudflare will not serve stale content while getting the latest content from the origin.

disable_stale_while_updating.description: Defines whether Cloudflare should serve stale content while updating. If true, Cloudflare will not serve stale content while getting the latest content from the origin.
disable_stale_while_updating.title: Disable Stale While Updating

status_code_ttl.description: List of single status codes, or status code ranges to apply the selected mode

status_code_range.description: The range of status codes used to apply the selected mode.
status_code_range.title: Status Code Range

status_code_value.description: Set the ttl for responses with this specific status code
status_code_value.title: Status Code Value

value.description: Time to cache a response (in seconds). A value of 0 is equivalent to setting the Cache-Control header with the value "no-cache". A value of -1 is equivalent to setting Cache-Control header with the value of "no-store".

origin_error_page_passthru.title: Origin Error Page Passthru

read_timeout.description: Define a timeout value between two successive read operations to your origin server. Historically, the timeout value between two read options from Cloudflare to an origin server is 100 seconds. If you are attempting to reduce HTTP 524 errors because of timeouts from an origin server, try increasing this timeout value.
read_timeout.title: Read Timeout (Enterprise-only)

respect_strong_etags.description: Specify whether or not Cloudflare should respect strong ETag (entity tag) headers. When off, Cloudflare converts strong ETag headers to weak ETag headers.
respect_strong_etags.title: Respect Strong Etags

serve_stale.description: Define if Cloudflare should serve stale content while getting the latest content from the origin. If on, Cloudflare will not serve stale content while getting the latest content from the origin.

disable_stale_while_updating.description: Defines whether Cloudflare should serve stale content while updating. If true, Cloudflare will not serve stale content while getting the latest content from the origin.
disable_stale_while_updating.title: Disable Stale While Updating

serve_stale.title: Serve Stale

Historically, the timeout value between two read options from Cloudflare to an origin server is 100 seconds. If you are attempting to reduce HTTP 524 errors because of timeouts from an origin server, try increasing this timeout value.
read_timeout.title: Read Timeout (Enterprise-only)

respect_strong_etags.description: Specify whether or not Cloudflare should respect strong ETag (entity tag) headers. When off, Cloudflare converts strong ETag headers to weak ETag headers.
respect_strong_etags.title: Respect Strong Etags

serve_stale.description: Define if Cloudflare should serve stale content while getting the latest content from the origin. If on, Cloudflare will not serve stale content while getting the latest content from the origin.

disable_stale_while_updating.description: Defines whether Cloudflare should serve stale content while updating. If true, Cloudflare will not serve stale content while getting the latest content from the origin.
disable_stale_while_updating.title: Disable Stale While Updating

Historically, the timeout value between two read options from Cloudflare to an origin server is 100 seconds. If you are attempting to reduce HTTP 524 errors because of timeouts from an origin server, try increasing this timeout value.
